rules: Rule1: If the green bond receives approval from the regulatory body, then the conservation project becomes operational in the protected area

Rule2: If the conservation project team possesses financial skills, then should the conservation project demonstrate business model viability, the conservation project becomes operational in the protected area
Rule3: The conservation project passes the technical committee review or the conservation project passes the ethics board review

Rule4: When the conservation project passes the ethics board review, then if the conservation project qualifies for the funding program, the conservation project team possesses legal expertise or the conservation project team possesses financial skills

Rule5: The conservation project faces opposition from industry groups or if the conservation project passes the technical committee review, then provided that the conservation project qualifies for the funding program, the conservation project team possesses legal expertise or the conservation project team possesses financial skills
Rule6: The regulatory body activates the fast track procedure or the conservation project does not trigger the emergency protocol review
Rule7: If the green bond meets the sustainability standards criteria, then the green bond receives approval from the regulatory body
Rule8: If the conservation project gains media attention from national news, then the conservation project receives public support from local communities
Rule9: The conservation project gains media attention from national news or the conservation project demonstrates climate impact urgency

Rule10: Under the condition that the conservation project demonstrates climate impact urgency, then if the conservation project meets the urgent environmental threat criteria, the regulatory body grants immediate approval to the conservation project
Rule11: If the conservation project secures funding from private investors, then the conservation project becomes operational in the protected area
Rule12: If the conservation project secures funding from government grants, then the conservation project becomes operational in the protected area
Rule13: If the green bond passes the environmental audit assessment, then the green bond receives approval from the regulatory body
Rule14: If the financial product requires modification under the legal framework, then the financial product does not comply with the new regulations
Rule15: If the regulatory body initiates the impact study process, then the regulatory body completes the impact study

Rule16: Provided that the conservation project team possesses legal expertise, then if the conservation project demonstrates business model viability, the conservation project becomes operational in the protected area

Rule17: Should the green bond neither meet the sustainability standards criteria nor pass the environmental audit assessment, then the financial product requires modification under the legal framework

Rule18: If it is not the case that the conservation project achieving international standard certification leads to the conservation project encountering legal challenges from competing interests or the conservation project securing funding from private investors or the conservation project securing funding from government grants, then the conservation project faces international scrutiny from watchdog groups

Rule19: When it is not true that the financial product requiring modification under the legal framework results in the financial product complying with the new regulations, then the regulatory body initiates the impact study process

Rule20: Provided that it is not the case that the failure of the conservation project achieving international standard certification to lead to the conservation project encountering legal challenges from competing interests or the conservation project securing funding from private investors or the conservation project securing funding from government grants results in the conservation project not facing international scrutiny from watchdog groups, then the conservation project undergoes investigation by the global authority

Rule21: Provided that it is not the case that the failure of the conservation project achieving international standard certification to lead to the conservation project encountering legal challenges from competing interests or the conservation project securing funding from private investors or the conservation project securing funding from government grants results in the conservation project not facing international scrutiny from watchdog groups, then the conservation project does not undergo investigation by the global authority
Rule22: If the conservation project does not become operational in the protected area, then the conservation project triggers the emergency protocol review
Rule23: If the conservation project does not become operational in the protected area, then the conservation project meets the urgent environmental threat criteria
facts: Fact1: The conservation project qualifies for the funding program
Fact2: The conservation project achieves international standard certification
Fact3: The conservation project demonstrates business model viability
Fact4: The conservation project does not face opposition from industry groups
Fact5: The regulatory body does not activate the fast track procedure
Fact6: The regulatory body does not grant immediate approval to the conservation project
Fact7: The conservation project does not receive public support from local communities
Fact8: The conservation project does not encounter legal challenges from competing interests
Fact9: The regulatory body does not complete the impact study

question: The conservation project becomes operational in the protected area
